backend/main.mo: Motoko backend managing sessions with events, scoreboard, captions, and lifecycle updates including start, icon selection, event logging, and end.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report mapping features to related frontend files, components, and test IDs with confidence levels.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten summaries of various frontend files describing functionality across pages, hooks, components, and layouts.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base/theme definitions providing color variables, dark mode overrides, and global styling.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point mounting the React app and loading main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Sets up TanStack Router with routes for landing, broadcast, viewer join, and viewer watch pages.
frontend/src/components/broadcast/Broadc: UI button component toggling mic state with loading and retry handling.
frontend/src/components/broadcast/Footba: Control panel enabling broadcasters to submit flag events with a dialog for team selection and reason entry.
frontend/src/components/broadcast/Microp: Helper component displaying microphone-related errors with messaging and a retry action.
frontend/src/components/broadcast/Permis: Helper component showing camera access errors and offering a retry button.
frontend/src/components/broadcast/Scoreb: Provides UI controls for adjusting team scores and roles, and updates the scoreboard via a mutation.
frontend/src/components/broadcast/Sessio: Displays the session code and allows users to copy it to the clipboard.
frontend/src/components/events/EventFeed: Renders a scrollable list of game events with icons and timestamps.
frontend/src/components/events/FlagAnnou: Shows a styled overlay announcing a flag event for a specific team.
frontend/src/components/events/LatestEve: Displays a temporary overlay highlighting the most recent event.
frontend/src/components/layout/FootballL: Defines the main app layout with header, footer, and social links.
frontend/src/components/scoreboard/Botto: Empty placeholder file with no implementation.
frontend/src/components/scoreboard/OnCam: Renders an on-camera scoreboard bar with team icons, scores, and offense indicators.
frontend/src/components/scoreboard/Score: Provides a styled card wrapper for scoreboard-related sections.
frontend/src/components/system/Unsupport: Shows a warning card when the browser lacks required features for broadcasting.
frontend/src/components/viewer/ViewerSub: Displays viewer captions or an unavailable message depending on state.
frontend/src/components/viewer/ViewerVid: Handles live stream playback with lifecycle state overlays and connection error handling.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and caches an authenticated or anonymous backend actor, refreshing dependent queries when identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useBroadcasterSession: Manages broadcaster session lifecycle, including generating codes and starting or ending sessions via backend mutations.
frontend/src/hooks/useBroadcastMediaStre: Builds a combined MediaStream for broadcasting, managing video tracks and dynamic microphone enable/disable behavior.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides Internet Identity authentication context, handling login, logout, stored identity loading, and auth client setup.
frontend/src/hooks/useMicrophone.ts: Controls microphone access with support checks, stream start/stop, error handling, and optional audio constraint configuration.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Provides React Query hooks for fetching and mutating session data such as metadata, events, scoreboard, and session actions.
frontend/src/hooks/useSessionCode.ts: Stores and retrieves the current session code in localStorage with helpers to update or clear it.
frontend/src/hooks/useSessionLifecycle.t: Determines session lifecycle state (waiting, live, ended, unknown) based on metadata and loading status.
Wraps browser speech recognition to track support, listening state, transcripts, errors, and start/stop control.
frontend/src/hooks/useTimedFlagOverlay.t: Manages timed display of unseen flag events, tracking seen items in memory and sessionStorage and autoâ€‘dismissing overlays.
frontend/src/hooks/useViewerLiveStream.t: Sets up a viewer-side WebRTC connection for live streams, handling peer connection state, errors, and retry logic.
frontend/src/index.css: Defines global Tailwind layers, color variables, theming, background styling, and utility classes for scoreboard UI.
frontend/src/lib/teamIcons.ts: Provides team icon metadata and helpers for retrieving icon info and scoreboard team names.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React app with React Query and Internet Identity providers.
frontend/src/pages/BroadcasterPage.tsx: Main broadcaster interface managing camera, mic, captions, scoreboard controls, events, and flag overlays.
frontend/src/pages/LandingPage.tsx: Landing page offering navigation to broadcasting or viewing sessions.
frontend/src/pages/ViewerJoinPage.tsx: Form page for entering and validating session codes before joining a viewer session.
frontend/src/pages/ViewerWatchPage.tsx: Viewer watch page that loads session data, events, scoreboard, flags, captions, and renders the video player with multiple overlays plus a sidebar event feed.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind configuration defining theme extensions, color tokens, animations, and plugins like typography and container queries.
project_state.json: Project state metadata containing app summary, architecture notes, known issues, and feature tracking for the live streaming system.
